website_summaries.verdict: The Grado GR8 headphones boast level resonance and audiophile-quality acoustics, but they're currently overpriced for the average listener.
pros: The Grado In-Ear GR8 headphones employ a versatile sound signature that complements multiple musical genres, and a lightweight architecture adds comfort
cons: In typical Grado fashion, the GR8s don't come with any accessories, and the small ear tips may present fit issues for some users

customer_reviews.title: more sound
customer_reviews.text: Great buds designed in Brooklyn,made in Japan. Great sound and presence. Beats my old Bose by miles. Even works in the subway.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: GRADO HEADSETS ARE THE BEST, but the earbuds were not
customer_reviews.text: GRADO HEADSETS ARE THE BEST, but the earbuds were not. They sounded like a $20 set. I hear the new models are better. I have the 225 headsets, and they are made in USA, and nothing beats them.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Good earphones; wish they had ear hooks
customer_reviews.text: I like these earphones. My only complaint with them is that the left ear bud doesn't like to stay in my ear. The earphones come with three different sized ear inserts. I've tried all three sizes on my left ear, but none of them work well. It's probably an abnormality of my ear rather than a fault of the earphone, but ear hooks would be guaranteed to solve the problem for just about any ear. These earphones are made in Japan.
customer_reviews.author: greenbreen

customer_reviews.title: The best portable headphones I have found so far.
customer_reviews.text: These are excellent headphones. The build quality is good for the price, but the sound is truly excellent. This is my third pair of these. I broke both of the other two by catching the lead on things. This pair has come with a substantially thicker cable. I don't blame the construction of the headphones, it was my habit of wearing them to do everything from housework to DIY with them on; they were bound to get broken at some point. I have bought a pair of Sennheiser headphones to do the DIY in to save the iGrados.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Bamford

customer_reviews.title: Have to admit I'm a bit disappointed with these
customer_reviews.text: Have to admit I'm a bit disappointed with these. I bought them on the recommendation of a friend. The sound reproduction is excellent so no problems whatsoever, there. But they are not a great fit for me over the ears. The reason that I gave 3 stars however is that they leak sound which can be readily heard by those nearby, even at reasonable levels of volume. For the money, I would not expected that to be a issue.
customer_reviews.author: RobF

customer_reviews.title: Best value headphones
customer_reviews.text: I use this headphones with my computer for music and gaming. It produce the sound accurately, good clear upper and mid range, the bass is just about right not overly exaggerated like most headphones. I have both expensive Astro and QPad gaming headset, neither of them produce as accurate sound as the iGrado.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Not £90 quality
customer_reviews.text: I like the sound and fit of these phones. However the cords are very thin and their attachment to the plug seems fairly flimsy. As such they are unlikely to last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Dr MKR

customer_reviews.title: Clandestine great sound!
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with these in-ear monitors which, although pricey, provide outstanding sound. They are not ideal for very noisy environments when compared to the noise-cancelling alternatives but they are discrete, your partner will never know how much they cost and I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: cd29510

customer_reviews.title: Great buy but you have to put up with some pain.....
customer_reviews.text: This product looks and sounds great. The negatives are that it bleeds sound and also can take some time to get used to the feel. At first can be uncomfortable but after a while it fits fine. Does look good on though.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: great sound but unconfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for the price, I prefer them to my Grado SR80. Somehow iGrado sounds a little louder and brighter then SR80 (after i made some penny size holes into cussions even bass is heavier). Still SR80 seems to have more depth and the sound is more relaxed and more enjoyable. Now the bad: they may look like portable but they are open back and leak sound heavily. Also very unconfortable for my ears. The drivers never seem to cover my ears completely and after one hour my ear lobes hurt like hell. I will try to put iGrado drivers into some other cans casing to see what happens. Will keep posted
customer_reviews.author: Ghio

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Audio
customer_reviews.text: These are excellently balanced headphones, deep bass, crisp mids, and sharp highs. The plugs they come with look really large but are great at sound isolation, and of course there's the distinct shape of the rear of the earphone - a bit pointy - but they don't look ridiculous. These are way better than the Sennheisers they replaced.
customer_reviews.author: J M SNR

customer_reviews.title: These sound great to my ear
customer_reviews.text: These sound great to my ear. After the initial 'pinch' on my ears I forget I am wearing them and can just enjoy the music. Once downside is that because they are open (by design) whatever you are listening to will leak out. So not great for the bus or the library, but fantastic on a run.
customer_reviews.author: mikerbiz

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound quality
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I did not award 5 stars was the fact that there is a fair amount of noise generated by vibrations on the cable which can affect listening.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Foster

customer_reviews.title: Both earpieces labelled 'R'. Lot of vibration transmitted via ...
customer_reviews.text: Both earpieces labelled 'R'. Lot of vibration transmitted via the cables to the ear. Returned for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Avoid!
customer_reviews.text: I read that these headphones were a decent - if more expensive - alternative to Beyerdamic, a pair of which broke down after years of blissful use. But Grado's IGI headphones do not compare in any way. The bass is nonexistent. The midrange is tinny. The finish to the casing is cheap and the cabling is flimsy. I gave them a fair run to let them bed in; nothing improved. I wrote to Grado UK's support team for advice; no reply. So i've returned them, bought another pair of Beyerdynamics and saved myself £25. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: nbreview

customer_reviews.title: great headphones? don't think so!
customer_reviews.text: got hese headphones after reading reviews in magazines and in here.i have to say for me they are a complete waste of money.the ear buds supplied are a terrible fit.you have to spend a lot of time trying to fit them into your ears ,if you can the sound is really good but this is negated by the the poor fitting buds because they just keep slipping out of your ears,they are either too big or too small. spend your money on something else .
customer_reviews.author: pedrosa

customer_reviews.title: Top 5 Grado Headphone - BoldList
customer_reviews.text: The Grado GR8s have earned a spot on BoldList's Top 5 Grado Headphones list! Pros: - Proprietary wide bandwidth moving armature design provides the listener with unsurpassed performance - Connector type - standard mini plug (gold over brass) - Frequency range - 20 -20,000 Hz Check out the rest of the list:
customer_reviews.author: james mccarthy

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality . As good as the SR80s Thoroughly recommended for cross-trainers or on the bikes at gyms. Have had to replace the jack plug once, but that is in 7 years of use, more or less twice a week. The wires do seem very thin but as above, have proved tolerant enough! Earpads now crumbling away so sourcing new replacements. Would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Failed
customer_reviews.text: They sound great. They are comfy. Ideal for mountain biking or gardening - they don't fall off. Happy with the purchase. BUT - the cable leading up to the jack fails. The cable is thin and somewhat delicate. Apparently the units these are "very similar, if not identical to those found in cheap PC headsets such as Genius". I feel ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Open headphone like sound, but poor build quality
customer_reviews.text: This will appeal to people who already know the Grado brand, who are looking for that ''airy '' open sound you find in open headphones. Would not recommend this if you're a bass-head or into music that's bass heavy. The build quality is unfortunately quite poor, wires look like they came out of an apple iphone or samsung generic , stock earphone quality. I dont expect it to last forever, but while it does, I'm definitely enjoying it
customer_reviews.author: hsianloon

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good, fairly neutral though
customer_reviews.text: Had these for a couple of months now. Sound is good, fairly neutral though, and there's quite a lot of cable noise which is annoying. Fairly comfortable to wear. A real minus for me is the build quality. The unit detaches and comes apart on its own when my iPod is in my bag far too easily. The cable feels cheap which for a £75 pair of earphones is a bit poor. Personally, I found the sound in the Fender Minor to be fuller and more to my taste. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Hotdiggitydog

customer_reviews.title: Very good but run in first.
customer_reviews.text: When i first got these i thought yeah not bad, pretty decent, then i read that you should leave them playing at quite high volume for a few hours. So i left them playing on shuffle while i was at work, now they have gone from pretty good to so good i hardly use any of my other in ear headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. I. D. Picken

customer_reviews.title: The price and sound is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I cant get enough of these. The price and sound is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Joda Cast

customer_reviews.title: iGrado Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are my third pair of these headphones as the end where you pull them out kept breaking after 7-9 months. However, I opened the third pair to find the wire and end has been changed to become more robust so hopefully this won't happen again!! The sound quality is easily the best of any headphones in this price range, and they do leak sound a LOT, but if your prepared for everyone to know what you are listening to then thats fine!! Other than that, comfy, well designed (although the 'back of the head' design can get annoying if you just want to rest your head on something..) and generally great!!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: I Grado
customer_reviews.text: These portable headphones are a bargin for around £50 they have the same drivers as the RS60's headphones.plug the iGrado's into your iPod or phone and they just sing if you use them for a jog they stay firmly in position there's not much difference to the RS 80's in sound quality in my option another top quality product from Grado
customer_reviews.author: Shredder

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant iGi's
customer_reviews.text: My brother has the larger over-ear Grado's and i was amazed by there performance, i wanted something that i can use with my iPod and i wanted in ear so i decided to give these a go and they are without a doubt the most warm and detailed in ear headphones i have ever used. They come with an array of fittings for your ears and they are just brilliant. These are way better than ANY of the Dr Dre beats that are out there and for the money i just can't see anything being better. I am looking forward to listening to my music all over again. BUY THESE HEADPHONES!
customer_reviews.author: Steviej233

customer_reviews.title: Headphone
customer_reviews.text: Never been a fan of earphones but after reading the reviews thought I would try these with my Sony MP3. They are comfortable to wear, the sound is great and would be totally lost without them, enjoyed all my music again.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. George Ryder

customer_reviews.title: Headphones
customer_reviews.text: These baby's have the lot. Great Sound, Great Design & a Great Price. Give yourself a treat & buy these. You won't be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

product_meta.title: Grado GR8 In Ear Headphones
product_meta.description:
Style Name:GR8A proprietary wide bandwidth moving armature design provides the listener with unsurpassed performance. Small size allows earphone to nestle well within the ear canal, maintaining an excellent air seal for improved bass and reduction of outside noise without causing discomfort

BOX CONTAINS
1 pair of GR8 headphones
feature_bullets: A proprietary wide bandwidth moving armature design provides the listener with unsurpassed performance.
Small size allows earphone to nestle well within the ear canal, maintaining an excellent air seal for improved bass and reduction of outside noise without causing discomfort.
Raised dot on left earphone provides tactile indication of channel allowing earphones to be put on correctly even in the dark.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.3 out of 5 stars64 ratings3.3 out of 5 stars
